page.title: 03Whitehall,Mealsgate.
page.content: First of all the historic house,known as Whitehall,belonged to Henry Percy Duke of Northumberland. Later it was passed down to the Salkeld family. Initals of the Salkeld's can be seen above some of the doorways.Launcelot Salkeld rebuilt the tower in 1589.All the Salkelds were Roman Catholics.In 1745 Henry Salkeld was a follower of Bonnie Prince Charlie,and after the defeat,Henry was captured and imprisoned at Carlisle.His land and estate were taken into chancellory,and passed onto the Charltons at a later date.They held them until 1858.Not much later,George Moore bought Whitehall,added a west wing,and built the stables. These are other points of interest concerning Whitehall:because of its long recorded history,Walter Scott used Whitehall as a model for 'Fair Ladies' in Red Gauntlet.
